headline: Bitcoin off to a slow start in Q2, falls 2.6% week-on-week
description: Bitcoin (BTC-USD) started this month on a weaker note after last month's rally, with the top cryptocurrency set to fall ~2.6% this week. As for the halving event expected in a little over two weeks, some believe current prices may have already factored in the event, while others argue there may still be some upside ahead.  "After hitting and breaking the resistance zone coming from the two major peaks in 2021, BTC stalled and started moving sideways but did not break back below the former resistance level, which is now acting as support. So that is an indication that the market feels quite comfortable here," said Julius de Kempenaer, Senior Technical Analyst at StockCharts.com. Kempenaer expects an upward break and a further rally in the next week or two. BTC started the week strongly, as it touched $70K on Monday, but dropped significantly below the mark on Tuesday, after the U.S. manufacturing activity came in hotter than expected. BTC, however, caught a bid on Thursday, on a day when the U.S. stocks closed lower, after some Federal Reserve speakers issued cautious commentary on rate cuts, adding more evidence is needed before interest rate cuts are implemented.  "Historically, BTC halving events have marked significant points followed by 9-18 months of uptrend, culminating in cycle peaks. However, for the first time, BTC reached its all-time high in anticipation of the halving, indicating a departure from previous cycles," said Matteo Greco, research analyst at Fineqia International. "If historical patterns repeat, we may witness an uptrend for the remaining nine months of 2024, leading to a cycle peak expected between Q4 2024 and Q2 2025," Greco added. Notable News  There has always been the group of Bitcoin (BTC-USD) and crypto related investors, but since the launch of the 11 spot Bitcoin exchange traded funds, TD Securities noted that the tune has changed as it is observing new money coming into the space from other parties. Bitcoin (BTC-USD) miners reported their March production this week, with Riot Platforms (RIOT) up 2% M/M rise, Marathon Digital (MARA) up 7% increase M/M. Argo Blockchain (ARBK) up 5% BTC M/M, while Bit Digital (BTBT) up by 6%, CleanSpark (CLSK) up 24% M/M. Cryptocurrency firm Ripple said it is planning to launch its own stablecoin backed by the U.S. dollar, making its first foray into the $150B market. Coinbase Global (COIN) has obtained a restricted dealer license in Canada, according to a Thursday media report, enabling the U.S.-based cryptocurrency exchange to operate legally in the country.  Bitcoin, Ether prices Bitcoin (BTC-USD) was down 1.5% on a daily basis to $67.6K as at 3:00 pm on Friday, and Ether (ETH-USD) fell ~1.6% to $3.3K. headline: We're seeing new money come into Bitcoin – TD Securities
description: There has always been the group of Bitcoin (BTC-USD) and crypto related investors, but since the launch of the 11 spot Bitcoin exchange traded funds, TD securities noted that the tune has changed as it is observing new money coming into the space from other parties. “What we're seeing is new money coming into the space,” Andres Rincon, Managing Director and Head of ETF Sales and Strategy at TD Securities stated. The institution added that it has observed some capital from existing crypto products shift over to the new ETF structured products, but at the same time it's also noticing a lot of new money coming into the space as institutions like BlackRock and Fidelity now have their names behind the space. “The evolution really has been that now we're seeing advisors and investors put a small allocation into their traditional portfolio. So let's say 3% or 5%, or what perhaps was your gold exposure before now is your crypto exposure.” Regarding inflows to the Bitcoin, it was only a couple of weeks ago that the segment notched a mini milestone as the cumulative 11 Bitcoin funds which started trading back on January 11th together amassed more assets under management than the world’s largest gold ETF. Bitcoin backed ETFs and managed futures funds: (IBIT), (ARKB), (GBTC), (BRRR), (BTCO), (HODL), (BTCW), (FBTC), (BITB), (EZBC), and (BITO). Bitcoin’s Price Action: Currently Bitcoin trades near $67,450 and is +137.6% over a 1-year period, +145% over the past 6-months, +50.5% year-to-date, and +0.7% over the past month. headline: Core Scientific mines 903 bitcoins in March
description: Core Scientific (NASDAQ:CORZ) said Friday it mined 903 bitcoins (BTC-USD) in March, compared to 893 tokens produced in the previous month. At the same time, it earned about $66.3 million from sale of 981 bitcoins. Its total energized hash rate in March was 25.6 exahashes per second (EH/s), up 0.5 EH/s from February.   At the end of March, the company operated about 224K owned and hosted bitcoin miners.  Press Release. headline: Argo Blockchain mines 103 bitcoins in March, a 5% rise M/M
description: Argo Blockchain (NASDAQ:ARBK) mined 103 Bitcoin, or 3.3 Bitcoin per day, a 5% increase in daily Bitcoin production compared to the prior month, despite a 4% higher average network difficulty in March 2024. The company sold its Mirabel facility and relocated its mining machines from Mirabel to its facility in Baie Comeau, Quebec in March. Mining revenue in March 2024 amounted to $7M, an increase of 55% compared to the prior month (February 2024: $4.5M). As of 31 March 2024, the Company held digital assets worth the equivalent of 26 Bitcoin.   More on Argo Blockchain  Argo Blockchain reports January bitcoin production falls 20% M/M Argo Blockchain stock sinks on $9.9M placing Seeking Alpha’s Quant Rating on Argo Blockchain

headline: HIVE Digital mines 224 bitcoin in March
description: Green energy-powered blockchain infrastructure company, HIVE Digital Technologies (NASDAQ:HIVE) showed March 2024 production figures of ~$160M of Bitcoin on the balance sheet. HIVE Digital (HIVE) mined 224 Bitcoin in March 2024, utilizing ASIC and GPU mining operations. This represents an average of 49.7 Bitcoin per Exahash, with a consistent average hashrate of 4.5 EH/s throughout the month, and an 11% increase in monthly average hashrate.  The daily production averaged to 7.2 BTC per day. The company has increased its Bitcoin holdings by 10% and its HODL position at month-end was 2,287 Bitcoin on the balance sheet. headline: Bitcoin drops 8% amid ETF outflows and Fed cut apprehension
description: Bitcoin has dropped 8% since Sunday night, as demand for spot exchange-traded funds slows, and hopes dwindle that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates soon.

headline: ‘We’re not believers’: Goldman Sachs doubles down on crypto skepticism despite Wall Street embracing Bitcoin ETFs
description: “We do not think [crypto] is an investment asset class," Sharmin Mossavar-Rahmani, chief investment officer of Goldman Sachs Wealth Management, said this week.

headline: Future of Finance: Coinbase’s Alesia Haas on why Ethereum isn’t a security and the crypto industry rebuilding trust after the FTX ‘travesty’
description: Haas also discussed the crypto bull market, Sam Bankman-Fried’s sentencing, and what drew her to the world of digital assets.
